comment: Butterscotch and some fruit on nose. Peanuts and red fruit on taste leading to medium finish with hint of anise. Pleasantly sweet. A must buy when in Louisville.
Best E.W. I’ve had. Worth the trip to Louisville for the bottle

So I’ve been drinking but I’ll keep it short and sweet !
So the nose is sweet got some caramel and a hint of oak
The palate: oak is present immediately with tons of caramel and butterscotch !honestly it’s surprisingly good and smooth!
I know smooth isn’t a word to describe something however this is such a caramel and butterscotch bomb it’s anything but harsh !
Finish: sweet as hell and amazingly butterscotch that hugs you the whole way 
If price isn’t included this is a very rare 92!!!!!
I can name on one hand the bourbons that hit the 90’s
Incredibly smooth and Rich. Ready to sip. Only available at their Experience in Louisville.

Mixing together the EW 23 yr, single barrel, 1783, bottled-in-bond, and signature black together into one delicious product.  Lots of oak at first, then vanilla and caramel.  Strong finish.  Only available at the Evan Williams gift shop.
EW tour. Loved all four, this one very complex. Only sold in EW gift shop.
